titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Procurement Services Records, circa 1945-Ongoing UA.10.03.0001
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Kimberly Sims; machine-readable finding aid created by: Molly Bragg

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-23 14:40:56 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Formerly known as the Material Support Department, Procurement Services manages Duke University purchasing systems. This collection contains memoranda, newsletters, catalogs and other records. Topics include Duke University administration.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

For a period of twenty-five years from the origin of the material, permission in writing from the office of origin and the University Archivist is required for use. After twenty-five years, records that have been processed may be consulted with the permission of the University Archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Procurement Services Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The procurement services records were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 1997.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Formerly known as the Material Support Department, Procurement Services manages Duke University purchasing systems.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: This collection contains memoranda, newsletters, catalogs and other records. Topics include Duke University administration.
